pullRequest.title: Move the DoesNothingAi to the ai package
pullRequest.bodyText:
The DoesNothingAi label is defined in PlayerTypes because it is used in
the player selection to pick a default AI for certain types of players.

Testing

Verified that the Does Nothing AI still shows up in the player selection UI.
Screens Shots

Additional Notes to Reviewer

The only change besides the code movement is the creation of the DoesNothingAiProvider and changing the label of DoesNothingAi to be a static String on PlayerTypes.  This way, the PlayerSelectorRow can check that static string instead of static player type, as the player type is no longer static.
Release Note

commit.message:
Move the DoesNothingAi to the ai package

The DoesNothingAi label is defined in PlayerTypes because it is used in
the player selection to pick a default AI for certain types of players.

nodes.bodyText:
nit, does nothing is two words, canonical convention for the project is to word-split packages with periods.
IE: org.triplea.ai.does.nothing
I do like on the other hand that 'doesnothing' represents a singular entity, I think it's then a toss up. In case of a toss-up, the existing word-splitting practice I think wins the day.
I missed this from the other PR, what is the purpose of this file?
This is now just a label for the DNAI? What do you think of adding a LABEL suffix to help clarify that?

commit.message: doesnothing -> does.nothing and change name of static constant
